pullRequest.body:
Following PR #17455, in which the ofScalars API was defined, this PR cleans up the file, fixes typos, adds additional infrastructure and implements the API in Analysis.Normed.Algebra.Exponential and Analysis.Analytic.Constructions. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

> Thanks for the PR!

Thanks for the review I'll get back to it this weekend
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks for thePR! Looks okay to me but an analyst needs to review it as well

maintainer merge
Thanks for the PR!

Thanks for thePR! Looks okay to me but an analyst needs to review it as well

maintainer merge

Can you please avoid starting a statement unindented and then indent it? Right now it looks like the statement is `FormalMultilinearSeries.ofScalars A fun _ â†¦ (1 : ð•œ)`.
```suggestion
theorem formalMultilinearSeries_geometric_ofScalars :
    formalMultilinearSeries_geometric ð•œ A = FormalMultilinearSeries.ofScalars A fun _ â†¦ (1 : ð•œ) := by
```

```suggestion
theorem formalMultilinearSeries_geometric_eq_ofScalars : formalMultilinearSeries_geometric ð•œ A =
```
Nice!

We try not to indent the main branch, cf the "line of sight rule"
```suggestion
  apply FormalMultilinearSeries.le_radius_of_summable_norm
  refine Summable.of_norm_bounded_eventually (fun n â†¦ â€–â€–c nâ€– * r' ^ nâ€–) ?_ ?_
  Â· refine summable_of_ratio_test_tendsto_lt_one hr' ?_ ?_
    Â· refine (hc.eventually_ne (NNReal.coe_ne_zero.mpr hr)).mp (Eventually.of_forall ?_)
      aesop
    Â· simp_rw [norm_norm]
      exact tendsto_succ_norm_div_norm c hrz hc
  Â· filter_upwards [eventually_cofinite_ne 0] with n hn
    simp only [norm_mul, norm_norm, norm_pow, NNReal.norm_eq]
    gcongr
    exact ofScalars_norm_le E c n (Nat.pos_iff_ne_zero.mpr hn)
```
Is the main branch the "last open goal", so to speak? Because by_cases generates two branches of equal "importance", so I like to treat them equally ðŸ˜†
Yes. But the first branch is clearly a degenerate case here ;)

```suggestion
theorem expSeries_eq_ofScalars : expSeries ð•‚ ð”¸ = ofScalars ð”¸ fun n â†¦ (n !â»Â¹ : ð•‚) := by
```

```suggestion
theorem exp_eq_ofScalarsSum : exp ð•‚ = ofScalarsSum (E := ð”¸) fun n â†¦ (n !â»Â¹ : ð•‚) := by
```
Not your fault but `n !â»Â¹` is ugly ðŸ˜ž
yep I agree :(, it took me a couple of minutes to parse the notation the first time I saw it
We usually keep one blank line
can you keep imports alphabetical?

pullRequest.title: feat: improve the Analysis.Analytic.OfScalars API and implement it for geometric and exponential functions
